text:
Polenka didn’t really understand what was wrong, but she was crying and shaking as she hid her tear-stained face on Sonia’s shoulder.

Suddenly, a loud voice shouted from the doorway, “How awful!”

Pyotr Petrovitch turned around quickly.

“What awful thing!” Lebeziatnikov repeated, staring right at him.

Pyotr Petrovitch jumped in surprise, and everyone noticed it and remembered later. Lebeziatnikov walked into the room.

“And you dared to call me as a witness?” he said, approaching Pyotr Petrovitch.

“What do you mean? What are you talking about?” Luzhin mumbled.

“I mean that you are a liar, that’s what I mean!” Lebeziatnikov said angrily, looking at him with his short-sighted eyes.

He was very mad. Raskolnikov watched him closely, paying attention to every word. There was silence again. Pyotr Petrovitch looked stunned for a moment.

“If you’re talking about me…” he started, stammering. “But what’s wrong with you? Are you crazy?”

“I’m not crazy, but you are a scoundrel! How awful! I heard everything. I was waiting to understand it, but honestly, it still doesn’t make sense… I can’t figure out why you did all this.”

“Why, what did I do? Stop talking in your confusing riddles! Or maybe you’re drunk!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Lebeziatnikov confronts Pyotr Petrovitch, accusing him of slander and expressing his outrage over his actions.
